item.title: Fuel Jettison System Main Tanks 1 and 4 Transfer Valves

remarks.para: May be inoperative secured closed provided:

numlitem.para: Required fuel to be jettisoned does not deplete inboard main tank below the quantity in the outboard main tanks, and
Both boost pumps for associated tank are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

placard.para: Placard adjacent to fuel jettison module in the cockpit: "#1 and/or #4 MAIN XFER VLV SECURED CLOSED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Main tanks 1 and 4 transfer valves may be secured closed by disconnecting the electrical connector and positioning the manual override lever to the closed position (AMM 28-16-04/401).
Gain access to transfer valves through upper wing access panel 573AT (673AT).
Remove and stow the associated electrical connector DV55 (DV50).

Position the associated actuator manual override lever to the closed position. For the #1 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and positioned down. For the #4 transfer valve, the valve is closed with the lever on the inboard side and positioned up.
Secure the manual override lever with locking wire.
